title: Script used on cover of GQ
content:
You’ve seen this image before in a previous ID for Soho”

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203225819im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/GQCover_4300.jpg)

Does anyone know what the script is that reads, “The Confessions of ...”?

Thanks for helping!

 [‹ instant-messaging font](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203225819/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41278 "Go to previous forum topic") [chocolatier logo: two fonts ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203225819/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41260 "Go to next forum topic")
author: malbright

comments.content: Thanks, Jan! You always amaze me.
Yikes, that’s a messy cover. What happened to GQ?
That’s the British edition of GQ, not the Fred Woodward-helmed U.S. edition.
One of the few instances in which Britain loses to the States in elegance.
